intro: Trichilia rufinervis, commonly known as the red-veined trichilia, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other economically important timber trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves with prominent reddish veins, giving it its common name. Its flowers are small, fragrant, and typically yellow or greenish-yellow, arranged in panicle inflorescences. The tree produces woody capsules as fruits, which contain several elliptical seeds.
